Agora sobre os atores üåª

trans:
The adaptation has garnered attention, whether positive or negative, due to the romance between our hero and the antagonist, Black Cat. While the romance between the two is not new, this is the first time it's been portrayed as a gay relationship. Whether people love or hate the decision, there's no denying the series is the talk of the town.
The series also tackles other issues such as mental health, toxic family relationships, immigration, and social vulnerability. It was even nominated for the Rapazeada Awards this year and was a finalist for Best Series.
This series is the perfect example of adapting a classic while modernizing it. Although it often plays with familiar tropes, it also excels at creating new dynamics.
In an interview with director @Opalinarevela, she shared that her motivation was to create a series featuring the hero she loved and, also one that resonated with her generation.
Now, let's talk about the actors üåª
(We'll save our favorite protagonist for last)
